name: Best Western Plus Arroyo Roble Hotel & Creekside Villas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I travel on vacation every year. This was a class act as far as hotels go. The views were fantastic, the free breakfast was delicious, the location was convieniant, and the bed was comfortable. The hotel had the best landscaping that I have ever seen.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels we have stayed in

reviews.text: If ever in Sedona again, this is where we would stay!!
reviews.title: Our balcony view was outstanding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family of 8 spent one night in Sedona during a 3 generation family vacation. The location of this attractive hotel was perfect and within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. The rooms were large; the beds were very comfortable; and the view from our balcony was fantastic (be sure to ask for a balcony room facing the hillside). I sat on the balcony with a glass of wine as I watched bald eagles flying by with the sandstone formations in the background. The desk arranged a Pink Jeep Tour for us (it is a MUST do). My grandchildren and I enjoyed the club indoor/outdoor heated pool and hot tub. I would definitely stay again and for more days.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - front desk not so much

reviews.text: Stayed at the Best Western for 4 night in early May. Had a king with balcony and fire place in the building next door to the main building. Rooms okay, but bathroom rather small. Views are great and location is good for all activities in town. I found the price $250 per night a bit on the high side. Free breakfast buffet certainly a highlight of this place! Very good in a very nice setting. Run by a couple - very good service!!
reviews.title: great retreat- Creekside Villas

reviews.text: "Good service" is not what the ladies at the front desk have on their mind. Very disinterested and short...clearly they don't want to be bothered. Next time I'll come to Sedona I will check out a different place. Friendliness and being professional about your job doesn't cost anything...if your staff are lacking these basic things, it mostly doesn't bode well for the future of a hotel.
reviews.title: Clean, Convenient, Good Breakfast, Beautiful View

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was very comfortable for the 3 of us, and the view was gorgeous! Breakfast was great (good selection of food, inside/outside seating...), and the facilities were great. We used the pool in the garden, and the bigger one next door. Also played pool and worked out in the facilities next door.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay in Sedona!

reviews.text: Sedona is beautiful and this is a great place to stay!
reviews.title: Second Stay & Still Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in August of 2007 and loved it then and still enjoyed the place this past week of August 2009! We were on a two week trip around the area and stayed here for 3 days. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are larger than a standard hotel rooms at many places. Having two wing-backed sitting chairs is a bonus as so many hotel rooms have one chair or mayb e a straight back desk chair only. The gvrounds are very nice and the pools are not too crowded. The view of the entire Sedona area is breath taking! We used the laundry facilites (in the building next door now - as they were on the ground level in the hotel main building on our last visit). Only one dryer was workinhg so this took much more time to do a couple loads than it should have - but the facilities are open for use 24 hours. Again the breakfast is a very nice bonus. Also enjoyed that coffee was available in the lobby all the time. Will for sure saty here again in the future! This time we were facing the fountain on the ground floor and people would walk past the room and could see right in the window. We all agreed that the location of the room was convenient but if anyone was changing they had to be carefull or go into the bathroom (toilet & tub room). I am going to email the hotel and recommenbd that they put up a "curtain" near the area with the vanity and sink so that people could be changing there with the curtain pulled and yet the room window would not have to be covered. Great Place!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with incredible views

reviews.text: Coming from Flagstaff, the hotel is easy to find along the main street upon entering Uptown Sedona.
reviews.title: nothing but positives about this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we arrived already shortly after noon, a very friendly receptionist (Ashley) allowed us immediately to check in and offered us to upgrade to Red Rock View (as my voucher mentioned, but my travel agent had erroneously booked a Town View...) for a minimal extra charge.
reviews.title: Good value for its price

reviews.text: We were a party of five and stayed in a two bed villa. It was very spacious and had two shower rooms and an extra toilet room. The main bedroom had a very swish bathroom and an extended sitting area with fire. Both bedrooms had balconies with views. One of the creek.
reviews.title: Simply wonderful

reviews.text: The facilities were excellent with cooker, dishawasher and washer dryer.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, nice location

reviews.text: Just finished up a 2 day stay here. Rooms overlooking the red rocks are perfectly appointed with nice balconies. Very conveniently located right in town, walking distance to most spots. Free coffee and full warm breakfast with fresh fruit was excellent! Talk a walk down to their adjacent resort which gives u creek access. This was an added plus! When in Sedona again, I would stay again!!!
reviews.title: Just finished up a 2 day stay here. Rooms...

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in September. Check in was fine and our reservation was in order. We had to take our own bags up but there were trolleys to use and an elevator.
reviews.title: A good option in Sedona with very friendly breakfast staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fine, clean and well maintained but perhaps a bit on the small side. The bathroom was quite small, and the sink was outside the bathroom in the main part of the room which was a bit odd.
reviews.title: Wonderful would stay there again .

reviews.text: Breakfast was included and in a separate room a short distance from the main hotel. It was a combination of cooked and continental food and quite good. The people who worked there were very friendly and kept the tables clean and the food well stocked.
reviews.title: 40th Birthday Celebration... had a blast

reviews.text: Wifi was free and pretty good but not super fast. It was easily accessed in the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a first class Best Western with wonderful room amenities, great location and views and access to Oak Creek. I have stayed in places not nearly as nice as this for alot more $$$.
reviews.title: An outstanding BW hotel

reviews.text: Their complimentary breakfast is the best and they have outside seating.
reviews.title: Worth every penny for the view alone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will return.
reviews.title: Great Room.
The Best
reviews.text: This has to be the best place with the best location in Sedona. We loved our 4 day stay! Everything was A+. Our room and view was absolutely great. The front desk was most helpful with everything. The breakfast was more than a continental breakfast and everything was so clean. I definitely think you should look into the Arroyo Roble when planning a visit to Sedona. You will not be disappointed. We never had time to use any facilities but if it is anything like the the rest of the establishment, they must all be great!

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Cottage
reviews.text: We stayed for one night in the "Cottage" which is a small home located at the rear of the hotel. We had two adults and two kids in the room, and my kids asked me if it were the "Presidential Suite" when we entered. The cottage doesn't really look like much from the outside, but inside is completely updated and has two great bedrooms and a living room with fireplace. We enjoyed the free breakfast bufffet, and it is in a nice spot. The public areas of the hotel are really nice as well, and it has free wireless throughout. If this isn't the best Best Western, I'm not sure what can top it. All in all, it is a great hotel. Don't be afraid of the Best Western image!

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: Great place in a Great Location......can walk to shops and resturants.

reviews.title: Perfect Girlfriend Getaway!
reviews.text: Four women celebrating a 20 year friendship flew from various parts of the US to meet up for a weekend of refueling in Sedona. We wanted a space that would comfortably accommodate all four of us that was located within walking distance to all the shops. The bonus of the villas at Arroyo is that they're creekside and feel isolated though they're seconds from wherever we needed to be for whatever we were doing. I don't know if the villas are all different inside but ours was a little dark and dated, but very very clean (imperative for our group) and afforded us the ability to hang together by the fire in the living room at night after a full day of exploring. We stocked our fridge with snacks (which saved time and money eating every meal out, and we used the washer/dryer so we could wear our workout clothes allowing us to pack lighter. We had some great conversations reminiscing on the back deck with the woosh of water flowing behind us. We had such a wonderful time at the Arroyo that we've decided to make this an annual trip. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Best in Sedona
reviews.text: FYI, we four spent an afternoon at the New Day Spa and every treatment was better than the next!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed here one night on our travels up to the Grand Canyon. We really wish now that we had stayed longer. The view from the bedroom balcony of the redrocks was to die for. Breakfast was plentiful and staff were very helpful. We will definitely be making a return visit
reviews.title: What views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here Sept 8, 2009. Lovely facility, very clean, staff was very attentive. Breakfast was just wonderful. They even called after we were in the room to make sure everything was ok. We had a great view of a lovely fountain and the beautiful hills of Sedona. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great facility

reviews.text: This hotel is right "downtown" (downtown in Sedona is not a traditional city block-type, more like shops in a strip mall. Not bad, different, very touristy.) This hotel has some condo's behind it which include a rec center that hotel guests have access to-- workout room, billiards, indoor & outdoor pool. The view of the red rocks (we paid extra to face them) was actually blocked from our first floor room by a cheesy cougar fountain that served no real purpose-- that was kind of disappointing. Breakfast was excellent and the room was clean & nice. But definitely overpriced at $189 + steep tax.
reviews.title: Good location & amenities, overpriced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the 2 bedroom cottage for 3 nights. After check in we drove down the hill and I must admit we were somewhat unimpressed. However, never judge a book by it's cover. Upon entering the cottage it was clean, comfortable, nicely furnished, with the perfect size kitchnette, and big bathroom with a jetted tub. The privacy from the rest of the guests was well worth it. The pool is conveniently located just behind the cottage. AND, last but certainly not least, who could forget the views of those gorgeous red rocks while sitting on the front patio with a morning cup of java. It is located in uptown Sedona and is within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and art galleries. All in all it was our favorite place to stay during our 10 day roadtrip.
reviews.title: 2 bedroom cottage recommended

reviews.text: Stayed one night on the way to the west coast and we were all very impressed. The room was spacious and clean and the view was unbeliveable. Two pools. The upper one very quiet and picturesque with great view too. Probably the best "Best Western" I hav ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Superb
Great Place To Stay
reviews.text: Great view of The Red Rocks. Excellent location for shopping. Staff was very friendly & helpful. Breakfast was wonderful... just an overall GREAT Place to Stay!!

This Best Western is located steps from the shops in uptown Sedona. We booked a Red Rock View Room. To me, very much worth it for the million dollar view. Great pool. Very comfortable beds. So close to the shops, you can leave your car parked at the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Spectacular Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I loved this Hotel. We stayed 5 nights. It was clean, comfortable, and had a wonderful view. The free breakfast each morning was great. Hotel is in walking distance to all the shops/restaurants. Front desk was extremely helpful in recommendations for us -- "first-timers to Sedona". Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend renting a jeep to tour the trails, Verde Canyon train ride, and Out of Africa wildlife park.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place!

reviews.text: No complaints at all. everything was great. The thing that really sets this place apart is the fantastic breakfast spread. These people really have it together. The staff was great, rooms were very comfortable, everything we needed was right there. 2 pools, they said they were heated and they really were! The location was perfect. Just walk outside and all the shopping and restaurants are right there everything within 3 blocks.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT. WILL RETURN AGAIN.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location - not too far from Grand Canyon - Day trip was an easy ride. Sedona is gorgeous. Don't forget to take Pink Jeep Tour fun,fun fun. Lots to do from hiking to touring or just to have a peaceful moment. Camp Verde Train ride really shows the beauty of that area.
reviews.title: Fantastic - staff was friendly, courteous and great source of info

reviews.text: Fortunately, we arrived for a week, with a departure date just prior to the Labor Day Weekend. None of us had ever been this far west - by the end of our first evening upon arrival, we knew we'd be back. We stayed in the Creekside Villas reserved over a year ago by my wife. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: The Red Rock Area Resort Satisfies

reviews.text: The rooms were outstanding, large, clean and well laid out. The front desk staff were extremely personable, friendly, and helpful. Our first full day after securing a $15 week-long Red Rock Pass at the Rangers' Station was wonderful. We listened to the locals and avoided the tourist traps.
reviews.title: Great!!

reviews.text: We just came back from a stay at this hotel and were very happy. The Hotel is in a great location for walking to shops and restaurants. We took a pink jeep tour and they picked us up in the lobby which was nice. Our room was ready early so we were able to check in. I would ask for a room on the first floor. Very nice location with a grassy area out front so the kids can play. The pool area is very nice and beautiful views of the red rocks while swimming. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Location
Great location, wonderful rooms, nice breakfast
reviews.text: As other reviewers have pointed out, the location is great and you can easily walk to shops/restaurants. And what a nice view out the windows of our room! We found it to be an affordable choice, and I recommend it without reservation.

reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the stay. Positives are great views, especially by the pool and the room (a suite) was very roomy and updated. Access to the creek is nice but unfortunately no walking path. The pools were great and the upper one has incredible views. The full breakfast is...well, full; however, not so tasty (what's with the salty oatmeal?). Foodies will need to seek coffee and breakfast elsewhere. This is a minor complaint overall as we would stay here again.

We stayed for 4 nights and were extremely pleased with our choice! Check-in was friendly and efficient and the room was very comfortable and clean. Parking was plentiful and free. We had a balcony overlooking the pool, and a wonderful view of the red rocks.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great room and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good (coffee not so good, but we hardly found any decent coffee in any hotel in our 2 week trip) and we never struggled to find table.
reviews.title: Room with a View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If possible we would have taken the Arroyo Roble hotel with us throughout our entire southwest trip...We wish we could have stayed longer. The rooms were spacious, immaculate and the view (we overlooked the fountain and cougar bronze statue) from our terrace was beautiful. We were in the shadow of "Snoopy" rock, on the edge of Oak Creek, and enjoyed one of the best complimentary breakfasts of our whole trip. The perfect value for anyone, especially families with children, who could explore the creek at their leisure. The villas are also for rent...great for a family. The hotel is within feet of the main tourist street, yet it has a quiet and unhurried atmosphere. We'd go here again without question.
reviews.title: Wonderful value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two days earlier this month at this hotel, located in the heart of Uptown Sedona. We chose this hotel for its location. Unfortunately, that's about all the hotel has to offer. While the views are stunning, the room was average, at best. The first room we were offered had a strong odor that smelled as if an animal had died in it. When I pointed this out to the desk clerk, we were promplty offered another room. The new room did not have the strong odor, and while it was clean, it was "well used". I thought that for $250 per night, we did not get the value we expected.
reviews.title: Great Location; Average Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel does offer a complimentary breakfast, which was quite good. The dining room, located in the building next door, was clean and well staffed. The breakfast includes hot food --- eggs, bacon, waffles --- as well as the standard cereal and fruit usually included. The staff in the breakfast area were friendly and continually maintaining a clean environment.
reviews.title: Great location, room, view, amenities, free breakfast & internet -- THE best

reviews.text: Overall, we enjoyed Sedona, but spent as little time as possible in the room. Next time we will stay in one of the newer facilities outside of town. Being close to downtown was nice, but not worth the cost and low value.
reviews.title: Serenity--Red Rock Views and so much more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't underestimate this Best Western! This is our third stay at Arroyo Roble, and it just gets better and better. Aside from the fact that the rooms are spacious, many with a breathtaking view of the red rocks, there's a complimentary deluxe buffet breakfast (where you can make your own waffles) which you can enjoy in the breakfast room or out on a terrace. There's free use of the resort health club, indoor/outdoor pool, etc., etc. There are beautifully shaded areas (which I personally enjoyed while my husband used the pool and hot tub). The location is fantastic -- we didn't have to use our car ... we could walk all over uptown Sedona to great restaurants, art galleries, shops, and the Pink Jeep tour that we love. I can't say enough about our stay. Four nights wasn't enough for my husband and me. The staff was great too ... always pleasant and very accommodating. As far are we are concerned, this is THE place to stay. We're already thinking of going back again next year with extended family because there's something for everyone here.
reviews.title: Great Location Great Breakfast

aka: Best Western Plus Arroyo Roble Hotel And Creekside Villas
